Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of people hired for the independent Russia investigation who are Hillary Clinton supporters, stating that "all" of them are Clinton supporters, when in fact only three out of eight have made campaign contributions to Clinton.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or data to back up the assertion that all the people hired for the investigation are Clinton supporters.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that being a Clinton supporter or having worked for Clinton automatically implies bias in the investigation, without considering alternative explanations or the rules of professional responsibility.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the campaign contributions or employment history of the special counsel staffers, such as the rules of professional responsibility that allow attorneys to participate in matters involving their former firm's clients.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that not all of the people hired for the investigation are Clinton supporters, as only three out of eight have made campaign contributions to Clinton.
